docs.title: Welcome to Podman Notes.
docs.text: For full documentation visit Podman Documentation Page.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Podman is an open-source container management tool designed to be a drop-in replacement for Docker. It allows you to manage containers and pods without requiring a daemon.

docs.title: On Linux
docs.text: To install Podman on a Linux system, use the package manager specific to your distribution:

docs.title: Debian/Ubuntu
docs.text:
sudo apt update
sudo apt install -y podman

docs.title: On macOS
docs.text:
To install Podman on macOS, you can use Homebrew:

brew install podman

docs.title: On Windows
docs.text: To install Podman on Windows, you can use the Podman Windows installer available from the Podman releases page.

docs.title: 2. podman pull
docs.text:
Download a container image from a registry.

podman pull image_name

docs.title: 3. podman images
docs.text:
List all available container images on your system.

podman images

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
REPOSITORY          TAG       IMAGE ID       CREATED       SIZE
nginx               latest    f6b22f3dfc8f   2 weeks ago   133MB

docs.title: 5. podman run
docs.text:
Run a container from an image.

podman run [OPTIONS] image_name

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
CONTAINER ID  IMAGE     COMMAND                  CREATED         STATUS         PORTS                NAMES
abcd1234efgh  nginx     "nginx -g 'daemon of…"   10 minutes ago  Up 10 minutes  0.0.0.0:80->80/tcp   quizzical_hermann

docs.title: 9. podman exec
docs.text:
Execute a command inside a running container.

podman exec -it container_id command

docs.title: Working with Pods
docs.text: A Pod is a group of one or more containers that share the same network namespace.

docs.title: 1. podman pod create
docs.text:
Create a new pod.

podman pod create --name pod_name

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
POD ID        NAME    STATUS    CREATED         INFRA ID
abcd1234efgh  my-pod  Running   10 minutes ago  efgh5678ijkl

docs.title: 3. podman pod stop
docs.text:
Stop a running pod.

podman pod stop pod_name

docs.title: Container Definition
docs.text: Podman does not use YAML files natively for container definitions. Instead, you use podman run commands or create Podman-compatible configuration files manually.

docs.title: Pod Definition
docs.text:
Podman supports Kubernetes YAML files for defining pods.

apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: my-pod
spec:
  containers:
  - name: my-container
    image: nginx
    ports:
    - containerPort: 80

To apply the YAML configuration, use:

podman play kube pod.yaml

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: This tutorial introduces fundamental Podman commands and concepts. Podman provides a powerful and flexible way to manage containers and pods without a central daemon. For more detailed information, refer to the official Podman documentation.
